div1.p: Wyman places Carter in charge of all quarantine matters in Cuba, except for the province of Santiago.

div1.head: Military Orders from Walter Wyman to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1899
div1.opener:
In answering this Letter, please refer to the initials in upper left-hand corner
PHB
McE
Treasury Department.
Office of the Supervising Surgeon-General
Marine-Hospital Service,
Washington, D.C., January 28, 1899.
Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine-Hospital Service,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
Having arrived in Washington in accordance with telegraphic
orders of January 23, 1899, you are hereby ordered to proceed to
Habana, Cuba, x and thence to other portions of the island, the
province of Santiago excepted, at such times as may be suitable.x
I have to inclose herewith a copy of General Orders No. 15, is-
sued from the Headquarters of the Army, Adjutant-General's Of-
fice, in Washington, dated January 20, 1899, embracing an order
signed by the President relating to quarantine in Cuba and
Porto Rico. You are hereby directed to organize the service con-
templated in this Executive Order in the ports of Cuba, the
provinve of Santiago excepted.

You are directed first to call xx upon Major-General John R.
Brooke, U.S.A., Governor of the Island of Cuba, with a view to
securing his cooperation in the measures about to be instituted.
Thereafter you will call upon each of the military governors of
the several provinces of the island and also the military offi-
--2--
cers in command of the several ports, particularly General
William Ludlow in command of the city of Habana, and Colonel
Black, who has also been detailed by the President for duty in
that city.

You will provide for the organization of the quarantine
service first in the ports mentioned in the Executive Order,
with the exception of Santiago to which port and province Pass-
ed Assistant Surgeon M. J. Rosenau has been detailed.

You are informed that the disinfecting barge Protector is
to be towed within a few days to the harbor of Habana, and that
the Bureau, in order to save time, has advertised for proposals
to furnish some eight steam disinfecting chambers with boilers
and formaldehyd attachments for use at the quarantine stations
in Cuba. You will make a specific report to the Bureau concern-
ing each port, recommending the kind of plant necessary, i.e.,
whether floating or stationary, and if stationary its location,
giving diagram so far as possible in illustration thereof.

You are informed that a disbursing officer of the Epidemic
Fund is to be appointed by the Secretary of the Treasury for the
Island of Cuba. This disbursing officer will be directed to pay
bills certified to by the regular quarantine officers appointed
at the respective ports, when these officers are regularly com-
missioned officers of the Service, or by yourself.

While the Marine-Hospital Service is given the control of
quarantine matters, including the payment of quarantine expendi-
--3--
tures, it is the desire of the Bureau that the military govern-
ors of the several ports, as well as the military governors of
the provinces, should be consulted with regard to the equipment
and running expenses of the respective ports.

You will keep the Bureau fully informed by correspondence,
or cable if necessary, of your procedures under this order,
writing a letter at least once a week and oftener if necessary.

That there may be no misunderstanding in the matter, you
are informed that you are in charge of all quarantine matters in
behalf of the Bureau in Cuba, with the exception of the Province
of Santiago, the port of Habana included. With regard to this
latter port, your attention is especially directed to the matter
of the landing of troops from transports, and some measure de-
void of danger from infection of Yellow Fever should be devised
for such landing. Your attention is called in particular to the
necessity of perfecting arrangements at Habana for preventing
the conveyance of Yellow Fever from that port of the United
States. These arrangements should be made and put in operation
as soon as practicable.
div1.closer:
Respectfully yours, Walter Wyman Supervising Surgeon-General, M.H.S.
lCS
Inclosure.
